title: Hey look, we're nerfing AD assassin damage by 100 (on Duskblade)!
body:
... better hard buff every braindead clicker in the game.

"We don't like it when a champ just up and 100-0s you with no counterplay, leaving you going 'wtf!' instead of feeling outplayed" (The assassin rework)

... and yet, when every assassin currently does just that, we buff them. Makes sense, right?

* Zed can just ult, E and AA and do more than enough damage to kill most mids or any squishies.

* Kha doesn't even need Duskblade to two shot people, but we're going to pretend it's all his damage.

* Kayn can literally two shot with just W+Q, no Duskblade auto needed.

* Nocturne has been one shotting people for ***YEARS***, but Duskblade is now his only means of existing, right?

* Talon has also been instakilling people for years, but suddenly he's just so dependent on Duskblade.

* Wu has always either one shot you or done nothing. So it makes sense to buff him too.

And that's just AD assassins. If we look at AP assassins, they are uniformly targeted one shots, but that's fine apparently. Meanwhile we're going to gut Zoe, gut Ornn, and gut anyone else who can compete with the golden children.

The game needs less damage, not more. I get that you don't care since you want LCS to be more "interesting," but could you at least *pretend* you care about the rest of the game? Just put LCS on a different ruleset or something so we don't have to suffer.

Echoing here, i really do feel like Assassins simply don't need the damage granted by the Duskblade proc to perform already. They were close to fine before it (not going to deny at some point AD assassins were all but unplayed), and they didn't receive compensation nerfs when the item was released.

The damage creep of the game does need to be reined in, and assassins should require their entire kits, or close enough to it, to drop an opponent from 100 to 0 unless they have an *extreme* lead. Instead we see AD assassins killing people with often no, or next to no windows of counterplay with only half their kits after a single item.

A suggestion, if i may; Assassins are intended to deal take out either unprotected or weakened targets, but not a single assassin in the game has a bonus to hard-cc'd enemies, aka 'weakened'. I would much rather see improve their team-play potential through this kind of pattern than simply raise their damage freely up to the point where they can simply shred any non-tank to 0 after a few kills. To make Duskblade still viable and promote counterplay, why not let it trigger only on hard-cc'd enemies? Perhaps raise it's damage if need be in this case.

There's so much accessibility to defence to make a 1shot; stopwatch, ninjatabis, zhonyas, new seraphs, abundance of shielding in the game ect. 

I think you just feel that way when you die to them but haven't actually played them yourself. If you die to an assassin it's most likely you're not building correctly, not positioned correctly, or got straight up outplayed. Don't blame the game, learn more and try to improve. 

Also a couple things i wanna note. Assassins who have no escape tool to get out once they get in ( think kayn or Talon ) need higher upfront damage than those that can because if they don't kill their target they're **useless**. Champion's like zed get lower damage in return for an escape after going in ( think leblanc, zed, katarina ). If these champions are 100-0ing you as easy as you are saying it's probably deserved since they got fed. It's only fair right?

Both Kayn and Talon are amazing at getting away, provided they're close to a wall, which is honestly not too hard to manage. The main issue i have with some assassins is that at some point they no longer have to worry about getting away because they'll have negated massive amounts of the damage you try to stop them with via their untargetability/invisibility.

And also, as a squishy player my issue with assassins is that in spite of the damage they deal, they aren't squishy themselves. Give three items to an AD assassin, and 3 AD items to a mage. Assume both sides hit all their skills, and the mage needs a defensive item to survive the assassin guaranteed, while the assassin needs no such tradeoff, their built-in survivability is plenty enough.

I don't mind so much that assassins can instakill, i mind a lot that they're much too hard to instakill themselves, especially early on.
